Uses of Class
Chess.Piece

  • Uses of Piece in Chess

    Subclasses of Piece in Chess 
    Modifier and Type Class Description
    class  Bishop
    The Bishop class is an extension of the Piece class and creates a Bishop piece.
    class  King
    The King Class is an extension of Piece class and creates a King piece.
    class  Knight
    The Knight class is an extension of the Piece class and creates a Knight Piece.
    class  Pawn
    The Pawn class is an extension of the Piece class and creates a Pawn Piece.
    class  Queen
    The Queen class is an extension of the Piece class and creates a Queen piece.
    class  Rook
    The Rook class is an extension of the Piece class and creates a Rook Piece.
    Methods in Chess that return Piece 
    Modifier and Type Method Description
    Piece[][] board.getGameBoard()  
    Methods in Chess with parameters of type Piece 
    Modifier and Type Method Description
    boolean board.check​(Piece[][] gameBoard, char team)
    Checks to see if the king of the given color is in check.
    boolean board.checkmate​(Piece[][] gameBoard, char team)
    checkmate() returns true if the king of a specified team is in checkmate
    boolean Bishop.checkMove​(Piece[][] gameBoard, int x1, int y1, int x2, int y2)
    checkMove() takes in the game board, current row, current column, new row, and new column as parameters and returns true if new position is a valid move for Bishop
    boolean King.checkMove​(Piece[][] gameBoard, int x1, int y1, int x2, int y2)
    checkMove() takes in the game board, current row, current column, new row, and new column as parameters and returns true if new position is a valid move for King
    boolean Knight.checkMove​(Piece[][] gameBoard, int x1, int y1, int x2, int y2)
    checkMove() takes in the current position and new position of knight's move and returns true if it is a valid move for Knight.
    boolean Pawn.checkMove​(Piece[][] gameBoard, int x1, int y1, int x2, int y2)
    checkMove() takes in the game board, current row, current column, new row, and new column as parameters and returns true if new position is a valid move for Pawn
    abstract boolean Piece.checkMove​(Piece[][] gameBoard, int x1, int y1, int x2, int y2)  
    boolean Queen.checkMove​(Piece[][] gameBoard, int x1, int y1, int x2, int y2)
    checkMove() takes in the game board, current row, current column, new row, and new column as parameters and returns true if new position is a valid move for Queen
    boolean Rook.checkMove​(Piece[][] gameBoard, int x1, int y1, int x2, int y2)
    checkMove() takes in the game board, current row, current column, new row, and new column as parameters and returns true if new position is a valid move for Rook
